Package com.scheduler.business

Class AppointmentService

java.lang.Object
com.scheduler.business.AppointmentService
public class AppointmentService extends Object
Class performs business logic operations on Appointment objects. Implemented using a Singleton pattern to simplify keeping Appointment objects in sync across Front End and Business Logic, and between those objects and the Database.
Author:
Dillon Christensen

  • Constructor Details

    • AppointmentService

      private AppointmentService()
      Constructor: Sets up DAO to create a list of appointments, pulled from the database. Sets up an instance of the Contact Service. Populates fields that help with front end functionality.
      See Also:
      • Contact Service

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AppointmentService getInstance()
      Creates singleton instance if it was not created already, then gets the instance.
      Returns:
      Singleton instance

    • getAllAppointments

      public List<Appointment> getAllAppointments()
      Getter for the appointments list.
      Returns:
      Appointments list
      See Also:
      • Appointment

    • getAppointmentById

      public Appointment getAppointmentById(int id)
      Gets an appointment by its unique ID.

      Lambda Justification 2: The lambda here is used to filter the stored appointments into a new list by checking if a given Appointment ID matches the ID of the Appointment being iterated. In this case only one should match so only the item at index 0 is returned, if not null.

      Parameters:
      id - unique identifier used to query appointment
      Returns:
      Matching appointment or null if no matching appointment was found

    • createAppointment

      public Appointment createAppointment(Appointment appointment)
      Create a new appointment in the database. If the new DB appointment is created successfully, update the internal list of appointments in the CustomerService instance with the newly created one.
      Parameters:
      appointment - Appointment to be created on Database
      Returns:
      Newly created appointment or null if creation was unsuccessful
      See Also:
      • appointments

    • deleteAppointment

      public Appointment deleteAppointment(int id)
      Delete appointment from database. If the appointment is successfully deleted, it is removed from the list of appointments in the CustomerService instance.
      Parameters:
      id - unique identifier used to query appointment
      Returns:
      boolean value; true if deletion was successful
      See Also:
      • appointments

    • updateAppointment

      public Appointment updateAppointment(Appointment appointment)
      Update appointment from database. If the appointment is successfully updated, the defunct one is removed from the list of appointments in the CustomerService instance and the updated one is added.
      Parameters:
      appointment - appointment with updated values and same ID field as existing appointment
      Returns:
      updated appointment if update was successful or null if not
      See Also:
      • appointments

    • populateContactNameField

      public void populateContactNameField(Appointment appointment)
      Sets the given appointment's contactName with the name associated with the existing contactId.
      Parameters:
      appointment - appointment to be modified

    • populateDateTimeFields

      public void populateDateTimeFields(Appointment appointment)
      Sets the given appointment's startDefault and endDefault with ZonedDateTime objects, created from the appointment's start and end. Time zone set to ZoneId.systemDefault().
      Parameters:
      appointment - appointment to be modified

    • deleteAppointmentsByCustomerId

      public org.javatuples.Pair<List<Appointment>,List<Appointment>> deleteAppointmentsByCustomerId(int customerId)
      Delete all appointments with a customerId of the given customerId parameter.
      Parameters:
      customerId - value of customerId of appointments to be deleted.
      Returns:
      list of appointments successfully deleted and list of appointments that failed to delete

    • getAppointmentsByTimeSpan

      public List<Appointment> getAppointmentsByTimeSpan(AppointmentTimeSpan span)
      Gets a list of appointments, filtered by an AppointmentTimeSpan instance amount of time after the current time.
      Parameters:
      span - the amount of time after now, to filter the appointments
      Returns:
      the filtered appointments or all appointments if the AppointmentTimeSpan value is not accounted for

    • getAppointmentsByCustomerId

      public List<Appointment> getAppointmentsByCustomerId(int customerId)
      Get all appointments with a customerId of the given customerId parameter.
      Parameters:
      customerId - value of customerId of appointments to be deleted.
      Returns:
      list of appointments found; returns empty if none are found

    • checkForESTBusinessHours

      public boolean checkForESTBusinessHours(ZonedDateTime zonedDateTime)
      Verifies that the given ZonedDateTime falls within business hours in the "ETC" Timezone.
      Parameters:
      zonedDateTime - Time to be checked
      Returns:
      boolean value; true if time falls within ETC Business hours (8:00 AM - 10:00 PM)

    • checkForNoOverlapByCustomer

      public boolean checkForNoOverlapByCustomer(ZonedDateTime startZDT, ZonedDateTime endZDT, int customerId)
      Verifies that the range that fall within given Appointment start and end times don't conflict with any appointments that the customer that is associated with the given customerId already has scheduled.
      Parameters:
      startZDT - start time of appointment to check
      endZDT - end time of appointment to check
      customerId - unique identifier of customer to check for appointment conflicts
      Returns:
      boolean value; true if customer has no conflicting appointments

    • isOverlapping

      private boolean isOverlapping(ZonedDateTime start1, ZonedDateTime end1, ZonedDateTime start2, ZonedDateTime end2)
      Takes start and end times of two ranges and checks whether the ranges overlap. Algorithm found on Stack Overflow:

      Stack Overflow Answer

      Parameters:
      start1 - start DateTime for range 1
      end1 - end DateTime for range 1
      start2 - start DateTime for range 2
      end2 - end DateTime for range 2
      Returns:
      boolean value; true if ranges overlap
